result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: POS-Bench Warrant

*$500 POSTED*
Tracking with 22CT7
Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Not operate any motor vehicles unless reinstated according to law. 
Comply with day reporting requirements; Monitor Drug Abstinence through UA's. 
Provide proof of participation in treatment program and continue in that treatment program. Follow through with all recommendations.

2:17 PM Defendant Victor Hugo Ramirez Jr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ali M Mahmood appeared by video for Victor Hugo Ramirez Jr.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. 
Court vacates warrant.
Def failed to post an additional $1000.00 cash and sign bond by 5:00pm on 9-21-22. Court orders Bench Warrant.

1:20 PM Defendant Victor Hugo Ramirez Jr appeared by video.  Attorney Zachary Derksen appeared by video for Victor Hugo Ramirez Jr.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for State of Wisconsin. Def had several positive tests for THC from Day Reporting. State requests increased bond to total of $1500.00 cash. Clerk calls CO Wilke from Day reporting. Def is part of treatment as out patient at Clean slate. Court increases bond an additional $1000.00. Def to post cash and sign bond by 5:00 pm. State still waiting for lab reports.
